name: NewYorker
text: “The Chinese lockdown was more intense than almost anywhere else in the world,” writes Peter Hessler, who teaches at Sichuan University. It wasn’t unheard-of for a door to be sealed shut during contact-tracing if a family was suspected of exposure. https://t.co/LV6Yus8yMW
